Articles.Content:
So I'm new here, and Squad mentioned a "rotor module you can get by editing a cfg file" I've scoured the Internet, but found nothing. I won't be back at my PC till tomorrow and i want to know what this is. (I'm new to the forum's but i've been playing since .18)

Original Post: (from squad)

[To Other person] if you're adventurous enough there's a rotor module in the stock game you can use by editing a part cfg file. It's still very buggy though.

Edited June 22, 2015 by lateasusual_
Grammar
According to this thread it's ModuleJointMotorTest.

So I'm new here, and Squad mentioned a "rotor module you can get by editing a cfg file" I've scoured the Internet, but found nothing. I won't be back at my PC till tomorrow and i want to know what this is. (I'm new to the forum's but i've been playing since .18)

Original Post: (from squad)

[To Other person] if you're adventurous enough there's a rotor module in the stock game you can use by editing a part cfg file. It's still very buggy though.

It has been hidden in there since .20 or so.. Said they would enable it in one of the next versions since it had a bug that would cause the game to crash when timewarping.

So it is sadly so broken that it is useless and seems like they just dropped it with no more information.

Really dissapoints me that they start working on features only to never finish them. Bet it was developed by one of the many devs that seems to have left/been replaced...

It has been hidden in there since .20 or so.. Said they would enable it in one of the next versions since it had a bug that would cause the game to crash when timewarping.

So it is sadly so broken that it is useless and seems like they just dropped it with no more information.

Really dissapoints me that they start working on features only to never finish them. Bet it was developed by one of the many devs that seems to have left/been replaced...

AFAIK they are way too buggy anyway. Even Damned Robotics had issues with them in the past, if I remember correctly.

AFAIK they are way too buggy anyway. Even Damned Robotics had issues with them in the past, if I remember correctly.

Of course it is since they never fixed the damn things and most likely let go of the dev that was working on it and then completely forgot about it like many other half implemented features.

This is something squad could have fixed long time ago and should have been at very least included in 1.0. This is the types of stock parts that would really add to the game, as there is so much possible uses when it comes to ball bearings and rotors. Since .18 we have had no such parts at all that really add to the gameplay.
